Gisborne Herald archives need new home to preserve local history and heritage https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/gisborne-herald-archives-need-new-home-to-preserve-local-history-and-heritage/UDGVGNWIMJBRJBJ2AN2OHGNQVQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/gisborne-herald-archives-need-new-home-to-preserve-local-history-and-heritage/UDGVGNWIMJBRJBJ2AN2OHGNQVQ/ Wynsley WrigleyCompany director Michael Muir says 'they need a home' as archives face uncertain future. Tue, 29 Oct 2024 03:40:36 +0000 Former Gisborne Herald managing director Michael Muir is pictured in the main Herald archives, which stores copies of the Gisborne Herald and Poverty Bay Herald dating back to the 19th century. New storage facilities are required somewhere out in the community if the treasure trove of historical records is to be retained after the Gisborne Herald was bought out by NZME. Photo / Wynsley Wrigley

Fewer letters: NZ Post mail deliveries could be cut to twice a week in towns and cities https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/fewer-letters-nz-post-mail-deliveries-could-be-cut-to-twice-a-week-in-towns-and-cities/ZJEPH6DZFNFTTB7DJPIV2FJA6I/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/fewer-letters-nz-post-mail-deliveries-could-be-cut-to-twice-a-week-in-towns-and-cities/ZJEPH6DZFNFTTB7DJPIV2FJA6I/ A proposed rule change could mean fewer deliveries to large parts of the country. Tue, 29 Oct 2024 03:30:58 +0000 At present NZ Post is required to deliver mail three days a week in urban areas and five days in rural areas. Photo / Doug Sherring
Whangamatā bach on the move again after 95 years https://www.nzherald.co.nz/waikato-news/news/whangamata-bach-on-the-move-again-after-95-years/6MJSMSLUSJDVDJQDZ4MKAO4W3Y/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/waikato-news/news/whangamata-bach-on-the-move-again-after-95-years/6MJSMSLUSJDVDJQDZ4MKAO4W3Y/ Al WilliamsA house built in Hamilton in 1929 and moved to Whangamatā in 1930 is set to move again.
